13.m: But Jesus rebuked him, saying, 'Be silent, and come out of him!'. -Mark 1:25 (ESV)

l.q: Why were the people astonished with Jesus' manner of teaching?
l.a: The people were astonished because Jesus taught them as one with authority.

l.q: What does verse 24 tell us about the unclean spirit?
l.a: Verse 24 tells us that the unclean spirit knows who Jesus is. The unclean spirits know what is about to happen to them, that Jesus will destroy them.

l.q: What do verses 25-26 tell us about Jesus?
l.a: Verses 25-26 tell us that Jesus has authority on unclean spirits. Unclean spirits do not simply obey Jesus, but they do not have power over Jesus. They can, however, posses man and torment and hurt man.

13.p: Lord Jesus, in this Bible reading even your words alone have the power to silence unclean spirits, who can make man suffer. While these days we do not normally see demon-possessed people, the evil one is very much present and active, influencing us to turn away from God. May you protect me from their bad influence and continue to work in my heart so I will always cling to you. May you surround me with people who are right with you and grant me the grace to continue to minister to others for your glory.
